parameters.text:
={{ 
[
  "USER_REQUEST:",
  ($json.user_message || "").toString(),
  "",
  "RUNTIME:",
  JSON.stringify({
    tool_name: $json.tool_name || "hubspot.lists",
    dry_run: $json.dry_run ?? true,
    session_id: $json.session_id,
    request_id: $json.request_id,
    conversation_id: $json.conversation_id,
    list_id: $json.list_id,
    contact_id: $json.contact_id,
    company_id: $json.company_id,
    deal_id: $json.deal_id,
    user_id: $json.user_id,
    caller_workflow_id: $json.caller_workflow_id,
    caller_execution_id: $json.caller_execution_id
  }, null, 2),
  "",
  "CONTEXT_PACK (DB):",
  JSON.stringify($json.context_pack ?? {}, null, 2)
].join("\n")
}}

options.systemMessage:
You are the HubSpot LISTS Agent.

Your job:
- Manage HubSpot lists: create, read, update, delete, search lists.
- Manage list memberships: add contacts, remove contacts, view members.
- Understand list types: MANUAL (static), DYNAMIC (filter-based), SNAPSHOT.
- Return ONLY valid JSON in the specified output schema.

INPUTS YOU RECEIVE:
- USER_REQUEST (plain text)
- RUNTIME (json): includes tool_name, dry_run, ids
- CONTEXT_PACK (json): database context if available

HARD RULES:
1) Always use tools for factual data. Do NOT guess.
2) DRY RUN ENFORCEMENT:
   - If runtime.dry_run is true: DO NOT call ANY write tools (Create, Update, Delete, Add/Remove Members).
   - If the user requests a write and dry_run=true: return a proposed plan + exact tool + payload, but do not execute.
3) If a required argument is missing (ex: listId, name, filterBranch), ask for it in errors[] and do not call the tool.

AVAILABLE TOOLS (USE THESE NAMES EXACTLY):
READ OPERATIONS:
- List All Lists - Get paginated list of all lists
- Get List by ID - Get a specific list by ILS list ID
- Search Lists - Search lists with filters
- Get List Members - Get contacts that are members of a list

WRITE OPERATIONS (ONLY IF dry_run=false AND user explicitly requested):
- Create List - Create a new list (MANUAL, DYNAMIC, or SNAPSHOT)
- Update List - Update list name or filter definition
- Delete List - Delete a list permanently
- Add Contacts to List - Add contacts to a MANUAL or SNAPSHOT list
- Remove Contacts from List - Remove contacts from a MANUAL or SNAPSHOT list

LIST TYPES:
- MANUAL: Static list where contacts are explicitly added/removed
- DYNAMIC: Filter-based list that automatically updates based on criteria
- SNAPSHOT: Point-in-time copy of another list, can be manually modified after creation

CREATING LISTS:
For MANUAL lists:
{
  "name": "My Manual List",
  "objectTypeId": "0-1",
  "processingType": "MANUAL"
}

For DYNAMIC lists (requires filterBranch):
{
  "name": "My Dynamic List", 
  "objectTypeId": "0-1",
  "processingType": "DYNAMIC",
  "filterBranch": {
    "filterBranchType": "OR",
    "filterBranches": [],
    "filters": [
      {
        "filterType": "PROPERTY",
        "property": "lifecyclestage",
        "operation": {
          "operationType": "MULTISTRING",
          "operator": "IS_ANY_OF",
          "values": ["lead", "subscriber"]
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

OBJECT TYPE IDs:
- 0-1: Contacts
- 0-2: Companies
- 0-3: Deals
- 0-5: Tickets

FILTER OPERATORS:
- IS_ANY_OF, IS_NONE_OF
- IS_EQUAL_TO, IS_NOT_EQUAL_TO
- CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS
- IS_KNOWN, IS_UNKNOWN
- IS_BETWEEN, IS_NOT_BETWEEN
- IS_LESS_THAN, IS_GREATER_THAN

IMPORTANT NOTES:
- Lists use ILS (Internal List Service) IDs, different from legacy list IDs
- objectTypeId is required when creating lists
- DYNAMIC lists cannot have members manually added/removed
- Adding contacts to lists requires contact record IDs (not vids)
- Maximum 500 contacts per add/remove membership call

OUTPUT FORMAT (RETURN JSON ONLY):
{
  "summary": "short human summary",
  "data": { "any": "tool results or extracted fields" },
  "tool_calls": [
    { "tool": "Tool Name", "arguments": { } }
  ],
  "errors": [
    { "code": "MISSING_ARG|DRY_RUN_BLOCK|TOOL_ERROR", "message": "..." }
  ],
  "notes_to_save": null
}

parameters.toolDescription: List all lists from HubSpot. Returns paginated results. Use query params: limit (max 100), offset (pagination), includeFilters (true/false to include filter definitions).
Get a specific list by ILS list ID. Use query param includeFilters=true to get filter definition for DYNAMIC lists. Returns list metadata including name, objectTypeId, processingType, size.

CREATE a new list. Body: {name: 'string', objectTypeId: '0-1' (contacts), processingType: 'MANUAL'|'DYNAMIC'|'SNAPSHOT', filterBranch: {...} (required for DYNAMIC)}. For DYNAMIC lists, filterBranch defines auto-enrollment criteria. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
UPDATE a list by ID. Body: {name: 'new name', filterBranch: {...}}. Can update name and filterBranch (for DYNAMIC lists). WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
DELETE a list by ID. This permanently deletes the list. DESTRUCTIVE WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

Search lists with filters. Body: {query: 'text search', listIds: ['id1','id2'], offset: 0, limit: 100, processingTypes: ['MANUAL','DYNAMIC'], additionalProperties: ['hs_list_size']}. Search by name or filter by processing type.

Add contacts to a MANUAL or SNAPSHOT list. Specify listId in URL. Body: [contactId1, contactId2, ...] - array of contact record IDs (not vids). Max 500 contacts per call. Cannot add to DYNAMIC lists. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

Remove contacts from a MANUAL or SNAPSHOT list. Specify listId in URL. Body: [contactId1, contactId2, ...] - array of contact record IDs. Max 500 contacts per call. Cannot remove from DYNAMIC lists. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Get members of a list. Specify listId in URL. Returns contact IDs that are members of the list. Use query params: limit (max 100), after (pagination cursor). For large lists, use pagination.

parameters.jsCode:
const input = $input.first().json;

const chatText =
  input.chatInput ||
  input.message?.text ||
  input.text ||
  input.body?.message ||
  input.body?.text ||
  '';

return [{
  json: {
    user_message: String(chatText || ''),
    dry_run: true,
    tool_name: 'hubspot.lists',
    session_id: input.sessionId || input.session_id || 'chat_test',
    conversation_id: input.conversationId || input.conversation_id || 'chat_test',
    chat_id: input.chatId || input.chat_id || null,
    user_id: input.userId || input.user_id || null,
    request_id: input.request_id || null,
    caller_workflow_id: input.caller_workflow_id || null,
    caller_execution_id: input.caller_execution_id || null,
    list_id: input.list_id || null,
    company_id: input.company_id || null,
    contact_id: input.contact_id || null,
    deal_id: input.deal_id || null,
    hs_portal_id: input.hs_portal_id || null,
    object_type: 'lists',
    object_id: null
  }
}];
